intro: Macrotyloma uniflorum var. uniflorum, commonly known as the small cowpea, is a leguminous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its small, upright growth habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that develop into elongated, cylindrical pods containing 10–20 elliptical seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun for optimal growth. This variety is valued for its edible seeds, which are rich in protein and used in various culinary applications.
